channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [OOZIE-228] For authorization we should use the ACL model
item.description:
Currently job authorization is based on a group (a la FileSystem permissions).

Instead, we should use ACLs as Hadoop does, the ACL would indicate which users/groups are allow to manage the job.

A job properties would specify via the following property:

oozie.job.acl=[<USER>|<GROUP>]*
item.summary: For authorization we should use the ACL model

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

Review request for oozie.

Summary
-------

Using an ACL model identical to hadoop.

supporting the old group authorization model for backwards compatibility

This addresses bug OOZIE-228.
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OOZIE-228

Please add a note for oozie config changes for new or modified ones.

For example,

For backward compatibility,
add oozie.service.AuthorizationService.default.group.as.acl=true
to oozie-site.xml.
